'''BAN''' is a [[Primitive Quendian]] [[Sundocarme|root]] with two different significations. BAN<sup>[1]</sup> signifies "fair, beautiful", originally having "referred simply to 'beauty' — but with implication that it was due to ''lack of fault'', or ''blemish''".<ref name=PE149>{{PE|Eldarin}}, pp. 149-50 (root appearing as "√BAN." and "√BAN-; BAN-")</ref> BAN<sup>[2]</sup> signifies "meet, come up against".<ref name=PE150>{{PE|Eldarin}}, p. 150 (appearing as "√BAN")</ref>

[[J.R.R. Tolkien|Tolkien]] experimented with the idea that BAN was related to [[MAN]] ("good").<ref name=PE149/><ref name=VT/>

==Derivatives of BAN<sup>[1]</sup>==

*[[Quenya]]: ''[[Vána]]''; ''[[vanyar#etymology|vanya]]''; ''[[linda]]''; ''vanima'' ("beautiful"); ''[[úvanimo|úvano, úvanimo]]''<ref name=PE149/>
*[[Sindarin]]: ''bân'', ''bain'' ("blessed, fair, favourable, good, without evil/bad element"); ''gwain'' ("blond")<ref name=PE149/>

==Derivatives of BAN<sup>[2]</sup>==

*[[Sindarin]]: ''[[govannen]]''<ref name=PE150/>

==Other versions of the legendarium==

In the ''Qenya Lexicon'' appears the root VANA-, yielding [[Qenya]] ''vane'' ("fair, lovely").<ref>{{PE|12}}</ref> In the ''[[The Etymologies|Etymologies]]'' appears the root BAN-, yielding Quenya ''vanya'' ("beautiful"), ''vanima'' ("fair"), ''úvanimo'' ("monster"), etc.<ref name=VT>{{VT|45a}}, p. 7</ref><ref>{{LR|Etymologies}}, p. 351</ref>
